title: Virgil van Dijk insists Man Utd clash is not Liverpool's biggest match of the season
text:

Virgil van Dijk believes Liverpool's Manchester United is now bigger for the fans than players.

Jurgen Klopp's side head to Old Trafford on Sunday as they look to continue their winning start to the Premier League season.

United meanwhile are languishing in 12th and could end the weekend in the relegation places if results go against them.

A huge gulf between the two sides has developed in the past year with 15 points separating them after eight games.

And Liverpool stalwart Van Dijk admits there are more important games for the Reds.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

"It's massive, but it's more massive for the fans. I think all of the Champions League games are as big as this," Van Dijk told Sky Sports.

"The whole atmosphere and leading to the actual game is bigger than some other games but I don't think it's the biggest of the season.

"The big ones are the Champions League and the ones that are hopefully going to win us the Premier League title."

(Image: Leicester City FC via Getty Imag)

United are the biggest price they have ever been for a home Premier League match with some bookmakers this weekend.

And their task has been made harder with both Paul Pogba and David de Gea ruled out of the clash.

Van Dijk added: "They want to bounce back for all they've done this season and it's not what they've wanted so far, but we want to go out there and extend our points tally and keep winning.

"They're not in the best way, they're not fully confident and they're not in the situation they want to be in. But the good thing about football is you can bounce back in any game.

"They might think this is the best occasion to bounce back from it but we know that. We want to go out and fight for every metre on the pitch and try and take the three points back to Liverpool."
description: Liverpool head to Old Trafford at the top of the Premier League and 15 points clear of their fierce rivals
